Blog.post: Capital Punishment Does any man have the right to sentence another to death? Even if the man is question has commited murders?

Too Far? You tease someone, using some light-hearted comments about his family and or friends, and he does too. He then decides to take this further, and spread a secret you told him in trust, did he go too far?

Karma Does it exist? You do something bad to someone else, does it come back to haunt you? Or what about if you do something good, does something good equally happen? What about the theory that if you are doing something good, someone else is recieving pain or something bad, or vice versa.

Do we have a stalker? (Contributed By Jo) How comes q is always followed by a u? Is it some sort a stalker? We see u all over the place however q can barely move around without being beside u. Is u jelous?
Completely Random Thought #1 I wonder what it's like to be friends with a lesbian
People In Relationships How come some people in relationships, always seems prepared to take so much slack(hassle, trouble etc) from their other partner? Is it worth it?
The Speed of Light Say, Technology improves, and travelling at the speed of light is possible. You are on a train which is travelling at the speed of light, and you turn a torch on. What happens?

Train Travelling (Contributed By Jo[Curly>Straight]) When you're sitting on your train wondering why it's going so slow and wishing it would speed up, every other train you see going by is going so fast and you wonder why is your train so slow, and then it does that annoying stop thing WHY MY TRAIN!

The Rule of Like-Like? You like someone, however you just know or having a feeling that they don't like you. However, you know that someone likes you, but theres just no way you could like them for whatever reason. I've noticed this in a few relationships really, very...weird.

The Internet Why's it got such a bad rep? It's good to use for reference, but if you like it too much, or spend too much time on it it's bad? It's ok to be online once in a while, but not on for more than 2 hours a day?

Percy Pig's=Drug? BBC reports on the latest news on the Marks and Spencers Brand of sweets known as Percy Pig(tm), it has been identifies that they contain a drug called tartine, information of which is below TARTINE INFORMATION Classification: Central Nervous System Stimulant How might the user feel? Relaxed Dizzy Excited Nauseated Energetic Tense How might they look/act? talkative white lumps on lining of mouth (leukoplakia) tooth loss What are the after effects? Irritability Trembling Anxiety Weight gain Insomnia Depression Restlessness How does it affect the body? weight loss bad breath shortness of breath increases cavities/tooth decay reduces sensitivity to pain/stress constricts blood vessels increases urine output increases blood pressure increases heart rate chronic obstructive pulmonary disease arteriosclerosis physical/psychological addiction lung, mouth, throat, esophageal, bladder, larynx cancer stomach ulcers hypertension (high blood pressure) heart attacks impairs sense of taste and smell decreases physical stamina emphysema chronic bronchitis heart disease ages/wrinkles skin gum disease erosion of the teeth mouth lesions (leukoplakia)

...the thick of exams have finally sourrounded all year eleven students in England and Wales. Almost Halfway through every major subject, things are looking sticky, and I'm not talking about the palm of jo's hand. The lack of entries could be put down to revision, however that would be a tick of such great proportions, like a president not actually winning the election, but is president anyway...but that would never happen.... Not much has happened, I'm still lurking and Jo is on her fourth boyfriend of the year. While bets are on for the length of the relationship, the odds of Jo going out with two people at the same time during the year are at a good 10-1. ;) Ah, gotta love Jo ^_^
